citation.article-title: Algoriphagus hitonicola sp. nov., isolated from an athalassohaline lagoon.
citation.source: International Journal of Systematic and Evolutionary Microbiology

p.s: Description of Algoriphagus hitonicola sp. nov.
Algoriphagus hitonicola (hi.to.ni′co.la. N.L. n. hito El Hito lagoon; L. suff. -cola inhabitant, dweller; N.L. n. hitonicola inhabitant of El Hito).
Cells are rods, 0.2–0.4×0.8–1.2 μm in size on MA medium.
Non-motile.
Gram-negative.
Does not form endospores.
Strictly aerobic.
Colonies are circular, smooth, convex, glistening and 0.5–1.5 mm in diameter after 3 days incubation at 37 °C on MA medium.
Produces a non-diffusible reddish-orange pigment.
Flexirubin pigments are not produced.
Growth occurs at 20–40 °C (optimum, 35–37 °C), between 1.5 and 5 % NaCl (optimum, 2.5 %) and at pH 6.0–10.0 (optimum, pH 7.0).

Acid is produced from d-glucose, d-fructose, d-mannose, N-acetylglucosamine, cellobiose, lactose, sucrose, maltose, trehalose, raffinose, amygdalin, arbutin, salicin, melibiose, gentiobiose and turanose, but not from d-sorbitol, myo-inositol, d-ribose, d-adonitol, d- or l-xylose, d- or l-arabinose, glycerol, d- or l-fucose or l-rhamnose.
Hydrolyses starch, DNA, pullulan and aesculin.
Does not hydrolyse xylan, Tween 80, mannan or CM-cellulose.
Produces β-galactosidase, alkaline phosphatase, arylamidase, trypsin, α-chymotrypsin and N-acetyl-β-glucosaminidase.
Nitrate is reduced to nitrite.
Negative for H2S and indole production.
Negative in Simmons' citrate test.

Sensitive to (μg per disc) erythromycin (15), chloramphenicol (30) and vancomycin (30), shows intermediate resistance to (μg per disc) trimethoprim/sulfamethoxazole (1.25/23.75) and polymyxin B (300) and shows resistance to (μg per disc, unless indicated otherwise) nalidixic acid (30), streptomycin (10), bacitracin (10 U), penicillin (10 U), kanamycin (30) and neomycin (10).
The predominant fatty acids are iso-C15 : 0, summed feature 3 and iso-C17 : 1ω9c.
The DNA G+C content of the type strain is 43.4 mol%.
The type strain, 7-UAHT (=CECT 7267T =CCM 7449T), was isolated from a water sample from the athalassohaline lagoon at El Hito, Spain.
